summaries.body: Employees of a San Diego restaurant arrived at work Thursday to find a sea lion pup curled up in a booth. Cute, yes, but also an example of a species being found in unexpected places because of a changing environment.

display_asset.caption: Julian Assange gave a speech from a balcony at the Ecuadorian Embassy in London in 2012.

summaries.body: The New York Times looks back at the Julian Assange story, after a U.N. report said Sweden and Britain should restore his freedom of movement and compensate him.
Six family members found dead in a Chicago home have been identified, the police said, and all suffered from "blunt trauma," although a full autopsy report was pending.

display_asset.caption: Megyn Kelly with Chris Wallace, left, and Bret Baier at a Republican presidential debate hosted by Fox News last month in Des Moines, Iowa.

summaries.body: Megyn Kelly, widely seen as a rising star as a Fox News anchor, has signed a book deal with HarperCollins, which expects a fall release.

display_asset.caption: The Rev. Nicholas Richards created a website, Roho, that makes available videos of the sermons of black ministers.

summaries.body: A website called Roho — “spirit” in Swahili — collects videos of the sermons of black ministers as well as data on who views them.

display_asset.caption: Continental, a big auto parts supplier, has a system it calls digital mirrors, eliminating cars’ Mickey Mouse ears.

summaries.body: Many automakers are demonstrating video systems that replace side mirrors with cameras, but it may take drivers some time to get used to them.

display_asset.caption: Downtown Flint, Mich., last month. Emails indicate that officials were concerned last March about a wave of Legionnaires’ cases and raised the possibility of a link to Flint River water.
display_asset.credit: Sarah Rice for The New York Times

summaries.body: Michigan state officials were aware last March of a wave of Legionnaires’ disease cases and a possible tie to Flint’s troubled water supply, newly released emails show.

display_asset.caption: Anthony Martignetti and Mrs. Fiumara in 2009, 40 years after their commercial was first broadcast.

summaries.body: Mary Fiumara, who played the mother who shouted “Anthony! Anthony!” from her apartment window in an indelible commercial for Prince spaghetti, has died at 88.
Your predilection for being a morning person could be linked to your DNA, genetics researchers have found.
A New Jersey man who accidentally flew a drone into the Empire State Building was arrested after he asked security guards there for help retrieving it, the police said.
McDonald’s has found a way to make a kale salad contain more calories than a Double Big Mac. Both unique offerings are available in Canada.

display_asset.caption: A rendering of the proposed streetcar line along a stretch in Brooklyn.
display_asset.credit: Friends of the Brooklyn Queens Connector

summaries.body: A planned streetcar line running from Brooklyn to Queens would provide a lifeline for a stretch of New York City that is starved of mass transit options, Jim Dwyer writes.
Since its premiere, "Birth of a Nation," by Nate Parker, has burned up search engines, eclipsing D. W. Griffith’s 1915 racist cinematic masterpiece of the same title.

display_asset.caption: Advanced weapons like the Patriot Advanced Capability-3 missile interceptor unit use semiconductors made with a little-known but increasingly important material called gallium nitride. China is said to want the technology to make gallium nitride chips.
display_asset.credit: The Yomiuri Shimbun, via Associated Press Images

summaries.body: China is spending billions on a major push to make its own microchips, an effort that could bolster its military capabilities as well as its homegrown technology industry.

display_asset.caption: Kevin Bacon in 2014. Mr. Bacon became the subject of a popular alternative to the six degrees of separation idea.

summaries.body: According to Facebook, "six degrees of separation" is a myth: People are more closely linked to each other — and Kevin Bacon — than commonly thought.
Two fireballs — an astronomical designation for meteors that appear brighter than Venus — were caught by various dashcams and rooftop cameras in recent days.

display_asset.caption: Boxes of marijuana in Denver destined for a dispensary.
display_asset.credit: Benjamin Rasmussen for The New York Times

summaries.body: National legal sales of marijuana grew to $5.4 billion in 2015, up from $4.6 billion in 2014, according to a report, which forecast sales to reach $21.8 billion by 2020.
Lawmakers in Washington, D.C., are considering a bill that would pay certain high-risk individuals if they avoid criminal activity and complete a "life map" program.

display_asset.caption: Adnan Syed in an undated photograph provided by his brother, Yusuf.

summaries.body: A judge on Friday will conclude a hearing to determine whether there will be a retrial for Adnan Syed, whose 2000 murder conviction was the premise of the "Serial" podcast.

display_asset.caption: “Bust of a Woman” (1931), whose ownership is being disputed, is part of an exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art.
display_asset.credit: 2016 Estate of Pablo Picasso/Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York, Philip Greenberg for The New York Times

summaries.body: Leon D. Black, the co-chairman of the Museum of Modern Art, was revealed to be the prospective buyer of a Picasso statue at the center of an ownership dispute between an art dealer and the Qatar royal family.

display_asset.caption: Matt LeBlanc on an episode of “Friends” in 1999.

summaries.body: The actor Matt LeBlanc, who played Joey on "Friends," will become the first American to co-host the popular car-themed show "Top Gear" on the BBC.
An American tourist has found celebrity in Iceland after he typed the wrong address into his rental car's GPS and drove six hours before realizing his mistake.

display_asset.caption: South Korean soldiers patrolling the border with North Korea. Both countries have escalated their propaganda war across the heavily armed border since the North’s latest nuclear test.

summaries.body: In an escalating propaganda war, North Korea has begun sending balloons into South Korea that are filled with cigarette butts.
The parents of Etan Patz say they believe a bodega worker killed their son in 1979, and have asked a civil court to overturn a 2004 ruling that another man was responsible.

display_asset.caption: A staged mass wedding in Shanghai, part of a matchmaking event to inspire singles to marry. Young Chinese can feel enormous pressure from their families to settle down, especially when relatives assemble for the Lunar New Year.

summaries.body: A group of friends in China, tired of the social pressure to marry, have paid for an ad extolling singlehood. The ad went up on Thursday at a busy subway station in Beijing.

display_asset.caption: Satellite imagery dated Jan. 25, 2016, showed three objects at the base of the gantry tower that were either vehicles or equipment at the Tongchang-ri launch site in North Korea.

summaries.body: Increased vehicle activity at a site near North Korea's border with China could be a sign of preparations for a rocket launch, according to a website that monitors the North.
A study suggests that women who watch rom-coms are more likely to accept male aggression and obsessiveness.

display_asset.caption: A stuffed mammoth excavated from ice in Siberia, and a skeleton of a giant ground sloth. Researchers say neither was on the menu at the annual Explorers Club dinner in 1951, despite what diners might have believed.
display_asset.credit: Left: Hulton Archive/Getty Images; Right: Universal History Archive, via UIG, via Getty Images

summaries.body: A 1950s club of explorers was said to have served its members mammoth at a now-legendary dinner, but DNA tests have revealed what the meat really was.
Black students were half as likely as their white peers to be placed in programs for gifted students, a new study has found.
A day after saying that Amazon planned to open 300 to 400 brick-and-mortar bookstores, a shopping mall executive stepped back from his comments.
